name: Ronnie's Pizza
description:
History

Ronnie's Pizza was originally released in 1984 for the Funshckin 84' by Funshckin Entertainment. It was Funshckin's second attempt at rivaling Nintendo's strategy of transitioning from a toy manufacture to a game developer. The Funshckin 84' directly competed with Nintendo's Game & Watch system and Ronnie's Pizza was a hit for the pocket device.

Story

In 1952 Ronnie Pots opened Ronnie's Pizza, a small mom and pop pizza establishment located in Balsam Hill. As soon as his restaurant opened it was a giant success, with pizzas going to hungry mouths by the minute. Realizing  that Ronnie couldn't manage the rush on his owned, his son, Ronnie Pots Jr. decided to help his Dad and deliver delicious pizza to the customers of Balsam Hill. Will you be able to help the Ronnie Pots duo take on the challenge of looming customers?

Controls

To begin the game, simply press A for Game A or B for Game B. Once the game begins, move Ronnie Pots Jr. with the D-PAD in the direction that you wish to go. When you aren't holding a pizza you can pick one up at a table by pressing A and then move to your desired table and press A again to place it. The B button acts as a quick step to the opposite direction for faster movement.                                   

UP = ARROW UP                                

DOWN = ARROW DOWN            

LEFT= ARROW LEFT                      

RIGHT = ARROW RIGHT               

A= Z

B= X

START= ENTER

SELECT= SELECT

Game A

In Game A, customers will appear from the left, bottom, and right sides of the screen one at a time. Your objective is to deliver pizzas to them by the time they reach the takeout tables.

Game B

In Game B, customers will appear from the left, bottom, and right sides of the screen with the challenge of two customers appearing at a time. Your objective is to deliver pizzas to them by the time they reach the takeout tables.

Scoring

You score points every time you deliver a pizza to the customers. The score is displayed at the lower left of your screen.

 

Misses

If you aren't able to deliver a pizza to a customer you will receive a miss that will be displayed at the lower right of your screen. If you receive 3 misses it'll be game over and you lose.

Strategy/Tips

  • If you place pizzas at the three tables ahead of customers arrival, you will have more time to deal with the next round of customers 
  • If you feel too slow moving to the opposite table, push the B button to instantly move across to that location
  • Customers can be greedy and will take any pizza they're given while at the tables. Be sure to place your next pizza after they've left or they'll snatch that one as well
